controller

Class CustomerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • controller.CustomerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(name="CustomerController",
            urlPatterns="/CustomerController")
public class CustomerController
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

      • makeReservation

        public boolean makeReservation(ReservationModel reservationModel,
                               int numberOfGuests,
                               java.lang.String restaurantEmail,
                               java.lang.String email,
                               java.util.Date date,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String details)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        makeReservation permit to create a reservation in a restaurant
        Parameters:
        reservationModel - the model used to store data into the database
        numberOfGuests - the number of guests of the reservation
        restaurantEmail - the restaurant email of the restaurant where to make the reservation
        email - the email of the user who is making the reservation
        date - the date of the reservation
        name - the name of the restaurant where to make the reservation
        details - the details inserted by the user
        Returns:
        true if all the data inserted is correct
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
